private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D
I must obey the Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller one
I can only perform primitive moves of the form: move a single top disk from one peg to another
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves (only for disks A, B, C, D) as part of a cooperative plan that achieves the global goal.

private_information: I can move disks: E, F, G
I must obey the Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller one
I can only perform primitive moves of the form: move a single top disk from one peg to another
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves (only for disks E, F, G) as part of a cooperative plan that achieves the global goal.

private_information: I can move disks: H, I, J
I must obey the Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller one
I can only perform primitive moves of the form: move a single top disk from one peg to another
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves (only for disks H, I, J) as part of a cooperative plan that achieves the global goal.

private_information: I coordinate and validate the per-agent move sequences
I integrate agents' moves into a single plan and produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move lists into a correct, single-step-ordered plan and emit a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance and the cooperative constraints.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi instance with 3 pegs (left, middle, right) and 10 disks labelled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg is empty; right peg has (top→bottom) B.
Agents are limited to moving specific disks: agent_1 -> A,B,C,D; agent_2 -> E,F,G; agent_3 -> H,I,J.
All moves must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only the top disk of a peg can be moved, and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Primitive move format required: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' (example: 'agent_1: move disk A from left to middle').

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You may only move disks A, B, C, D. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact text format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and you must only specify moves that involve disks you are permitted to move. Do not emit PDDL. Ensure moves are globally consistent with the public information and indicate no assumptions beyond your private information and the public information.

You are agent_2. You may only move disks E, F, G. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact text format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and you must only specify moves that involve disks you are permitted to move. Do not emit PDDL. Ensure moves are globally consistent with the public information and indicate no assumptions beyond your private information and the public information.

You are agent_3. You may only move disks H, I, J. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact text format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and you must only specify moves that involve disks you are permitted to move. Do not emit PDDL. Ensure moves are globally consistent with the public information and indicate no assumptions beyond your private information and the public information.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to validate and assemble the agents' primitive move lists into a single correct ordered plan that respects Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk-move restrictions. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file encoding the Tower of Hanoi instance and the integrated plan, targeting the FastDownwards solver. Provide the PDDL domain and problem in separate sections enclosed between <domain>...</domain> and <problem>...</problem> tags respectively. Keep the agents' actions distinct in the encoding (e.g., action names referencing agent_1/agent_2/agent_3). Ensure the generated PDDL accurately models pegs, disks, sizes, initial and goal configurations, and agent-specific move capabilities.
